messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, my girlfriend just pulled up and there's a guy that pulled up in a truck behind her. We think he has a gun.
What's the address?
914 Stephen Street, Jessup, Iowa. I mean, they're arguing by a truck. We've seen a gun.
Okay, hold on just a second.
Okay.
Okay, what's your name?
Chase Weber.
Trace Weber?
Chase, C-H-A-S-E.
And it was your girlfriend that just got home?
Yes.
What's her name?
Lindsay Nichols.
Do you know who the person is in the truck?
I'm assuming it's her ex, but I don't know his name or who he is.
What kind of truck is it?
It looks like a Chevy, maybe a Colorado? I'm not sure.
Do you know what color it is?
Silver, hurry, please.
The police are on the way. I'm talking to you as they are en route, okay? So you don't need to be yelling at me.
I'm sorry. I'm just looking out the window.
What color is the truck?
Silver or gray, I believe.
If it leaves before the officers get there, let me know. Is Lindsay still outside?
Oh, my gosh!
What's happening?
He just shot her! He just shot her!
Stay on the line. The police are almost there.
He shot her and then shot himself! I think he's down. I can't see where she's been shot. Lindsay, where have you been hit?
I'm paging the ambulance right now, just hold on.
I don't know where she's been hit.
Can you check her safely?
I don't know what to do.
Okay, is the officer there?
Yes, he’s assessing the scene.
All right, the officer is there and I have an ambulance on the way, so I'm going to let you go, okay?
Okay. Thank you.
